body_html:
@XingxingZhang The legacy packages are stored in Google Drive through this link. (Some are uploading, just wait a moment.) If you are a user from China, then you can get it from BaiduNetDisk.
@tesslerc Some users reported this issue when using the CI package. I think that I have included all the dependencies in the package, especially the CUDA files. You can try installing VS2017 BuildTools for C++ or the Windows 10 SDK and see whether the issue is resolved.
body_text:
@XingxingZhang The legacy packages are stored in Google Drive through this link. (Some are uploading, just wait a moment.) If you are a user from China, then you can get it from BaiduNetDisk.
@tesslerc Some users reported this issue when using the CI package. I think that I have included all the dependencies in the package, especially the CUDA files. You can try installing VS2017 BuildTools for C++ or the Windows 10 SDK and see whether the issue is resolved.
body:
@XingxingZhang The legacy packages are stored in Google Drive through this [link](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B-X0-FlSGfCYdTNldW02UGl4MXM?usp=sharing). (Some are uploading, just wait a moment.) If you are a user from China, then you can get it from [BaiduNetDisk](https://pan.baidu.com/s/1dF6ayLr).
@tesslerc Some users reported this issue when using the CI package. I think that I have included all the dependencies in the package, especially the CUDA files. You can try installing VS2017 BuildTools for C++ or the Windows 10 SDK and see whether the issue is resolved.
